This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."}},"title":"DStakeRouterV2GovernanceModule","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"moduleMetadata()":{"notice":"Returns module wiring metadata used to validate compatibility during router configuration."}},"notice":"Contains governance and configuration mutators for {@link DStakeRouterV2} executed via delegatecall.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/vaults/dstake/DStakeRouterV2GovernanceModule.sol":"DStakeRouterV2GovernanceModule"},"evmVersion":"paris","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs","useLiteralContent":true},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n// OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.4.0) (access/AccessControl.sol)\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport {IAccessControl} from \"./IAccessControl.sol\";\nimport {Context} from \"../utils/Context.sol\";\nimport {IERC165, ERC165} from \"../utils/introspection/ERC165.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Contract module that allows children to implement role-based access\n * control mechanisms. This is a lightweight version that doesn't allow enumerating role\n * members except through off-chain means by accessing the contract event logs. Some\n * applications may benefit from on-chain enumerability, for those cases see\n * {AccessControlEnumerable}.\n *\n * Roles are referred to by their `bytes32` identifier. These should be exposed\n * in the external API and be unique. The best way to achieve this is by\n * using `public constant` hash digests:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * bytes32 public constant MY_ROLE = keccak256(\"MY_ROLE\");\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be used to represent a set of permissions. To restrict access to a\n * function call, use {hasRole}:\n *\n * ```solidity\n * function foo() public {\n *     require(hasRole(MY_ROLE, msg.sender));\n *     ...\n * }\n * ```\n *\n * Roles can be granted and revoked dynamically via the {grantRole} and\n * {revokeRole} functions. Each role has an associated admin role, and only\n * accounts that have a role's admin role can call {grantRole} and {revokeRole}.\n *\n * By default, the admin role for all roles is `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`, which means\n * that only accounts with this role will be able to grant or revoke other\n * roles. More complex role relationships can be created by using\n * {_setRoleAdmin}.\n *\n * WARNING: The `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is also its own admin: it has permission to\n * grant and revoke this role. Extra precautions should be taken to secure\n * accounts that have been granted it. We recommend using {AccessControlDefaultAdminRules}\n * to enforce additional security measures for this role.\n */\nabstract contract AccessControl is Context, IAccessControl, ERC165 {\n    struct RoleData {\n        mapping(address account => bool) hasRole;\n        bytes32 adminRole;\n    }\n\n    mapping(bytes32 role => RoleData) private _roles;\n\n    bytes32 public constant DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE = 0x00;\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Modifier that checks that an account has a specific role. Reverts\n     * with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error including the required role.\n     */\n    modifier onlyRole(bytes32 role) {\n        _checkRole(role);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /// @inheritdoc IERC165\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override returns (bool) {\n        return interfaceId == type(IAccessControl).interfaceId || super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`.\n     */\n    function hasRole(bytes32 role, address account) public view virtual returns (bool) {\n        return _roles[role].hasRole[account];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error if `_msgSender()`\n     * is missing `role`. Overriding this function changes the behavior of the {onlyRole} modifier.\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role) internal view virtual {\n        _checkRole(role, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Reverts with an {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount} error if `account`\n     * is missing `role`.\n     */\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal view virtual {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            revert AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(account, role);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and\n     * {revokeRole}.\n     *\n     * To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.\n     */\n    function getRoleAdmin(bytes32 role) public view virtual returns (bytes32) {\n        return _roles[role].adminRole;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Grants `role` to `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleGranted} event.\n     */\n    function grantRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual onlyRole(getRoleAdmin(role)) {\n        _grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from `account`.\n     *\n     * If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     */\n    function revokeRole(bytes32 role, address account) public virtual onlyRole(getRoleAdmin(role)) {\n        _revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Revokes `role` from the calling account.\n     *\n     * Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's\n     * purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges\n     * if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced).\n     *\n     * If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked}\n     * event.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`.\n     *\n     * May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.\n     */\n    function renounceRole(bytes32 role, address callerConfirmation) public virtual {\n        if (callerConfirmation != _msgSender()) {\n            revert AccessControlBadConfirmation();\n        }\n\n        _revokeRole(role, callerConfirmation);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Sets `adminRole` as ``role``'s admin role.\n     *\n     * Emits a {RoleAdminChanged} event.\n     */\n    function _setRoleAdmin(bytes32 role, bytes32 adminRole) internal virtual {\n        bytes32 previousAdminRole SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport { IERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol\";\nimport { SafeERC20 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport { IERC4626 } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC4626.sol\";\nimport { Math } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol\";\n\nimport { AllocationCalculator } from \"./libraries/AllocationCalculator.sol\";\nimport { BasisPointConstants } from \"../../common/BasisPointConstants.sol\";\nimport { IDStableConversionAdapterV2 } from \"./interfaces/IDStableConversionAdapterV2.sol\";\nimport { DStakeRouterV2Storage } from \"./DStakeRouterV2Storage.sol\";\nimport { IDStakeRouterV2Module } from \"./interfaces/IDStakeRouterV2Module.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title DStakeRouterV2GovernanceModule\n * @notice Contains governance and configuration mutators for {@link DStakeRouterV2} executed via delegatecall.\n * @dev This contract is designed to be delegate-called from the router. Storage layout **must** match the router's\n *      layout for all shared state variables, including inherited OpenZeppelin base contracts. Access control checks\n *      are enforced at the router level before delegating to this module.\n */\ncontract DStakeRouterV2GovernanceModule is DStakeRouterV2Storage, IDStakeRouterV2Module {\n    using SafeERC20 for IERC20;\n    using AllocationCalculator for uint256[];\n    using Math for uint256;\n\n    // --- Errors ---\n    error AdapterNotFound(address strategyShare);\n    error ZeroPreviewWithdrawAmount(address strategyShare);\n    error VaultAssetManagedByDifferentAdapter(address strategyShare, address existingAdapter);\n    error ZeroInputDStableValue(address fromAsset, uint256 fromAmount);\n    error AdapterAssetMismatch(address adapter, address expectedAsset, address actualAsset);\n    error SlippageCheckFailed(address asset, uint256 actualAmount, uint256 requiredAmount);\n    error AdapterSharesMismatch(uint256 actualShares, uint256 reportedShares);\n    error InvalidAmount();\n    error InvalidVaultConfig();\n    error VaultNotActive(address vault);\n    error VaultNotFound(address vault);\n    error InsufficientActiveVaults();\n    error VaultAlreadyExists(address vault);\n    error TotalAllocationInvalid(uint256 total);\n    error NoLiquidityAvailable();\n    error InvalidMaxVaultCount(uint256 count);\n    error EmptyArrays();\n    error IndexOutOfBounds();\n    error WithdrawalShortfall(uint256 expectedNet, uint256 actualNet);\n    error ReceiverZero();\n    error DepositCapExceeded(uint256 cap, uint256 currentManaged, uint256 incomingAssets);\n    error SharesBelowMinimum(uint256 actualShares, uint256 minShares);\n    error SharesExceedMaxRedeem(uint256 requestedShares, uint256 maxShares);\n    error InvalidDepositCap(uint256 newCap, uint256 currentManaged);\n    error InvalidReinvestIncentive(uint256 incentiveBps, uint256 maxBps);\n    error SettlementShortfallTooHigh(uint256 shortfall, uint256 managedAssets);\n    error UnauthorizedConfigCaller();\n    error InvalidWithdrawalFee(uint256 feeBps, uint256 maxFeeBps);\n    error VaultMustBeSuspended(address vault);\n    error VaultTargetNotZero(address vault, uint256 targetBps);\n\n    // --- Events ---\n    event AdapterSet(address indexed strategyShare, address adapterAddress);\n    event AdapterRemoved(address indexed strategyShare, address adapterAddress);\n    event DefaultDepositStrategyShareSet(address indexed strategyShare);\n    event DustToleranceSet(uint256 newDustTolerance);\n    event SurplusSwept(uint256 amount, address vaultAsset);\n    event SettlementShortfallUpdated(uint256 previousShortfall, uint256 newShortfall);\n    event DepositCapUpdated(uint256 previousCap, uint256 newCap);\n    event ReinvestIncentiveSet(uint256 newIncentiveBps);\n    event WithdrawalFeeSet(uint256 previousFeeBps, uint256 newFeeBps);\n    event VaultConfigAdded(address indexed vault, address indexed adapter, uint256 targetBps, VaultStatus status);\n    event VaultConfigUpdated(address indexed vault, address indexed adapter, uint256 targetBps, VaultStatus status);\n    event VaultConfigRemoved(address indexed vault);\n    event MaxVaultCountUpdated(uint256 oldCount, uint256 newCount);\n\n    constructor(address dStakeToken_, address collateralVault_) DStakeRouterV2Storage(dStakeToken_, collateralVault_) {}\n\n    // --- Module metadata ---\n\n    function moduleMetadata()\n        external\n        view\n        returns (bytes32 storageFingerprint, address dStakeTokenAddress, address collateralVaultAddress)\n    {\n        return (STORAGE_FINGERPRINT, _dStakeToken, address(_collateralVault));\n    }\n\n    // --- Governance entry points (delegate-called) ---\n\n    function setReinvestIncentive(uint256 newIncentiveBps) external {\n        if (newIncentiveBps > MAX_REINVEST_INCENTIVE_BPS) {\n            revert InvalidReinvestIncentive(newIncentiveBps, MAX_REINVEST_INCENTIVE_BPS);\n        }\n        reinvestIncentiveBps = newIncentiveBps;\n        emit ReinvestIncentiveSet(newIncentiveBps);\n    }\n\n    function setWithdrawalFee(uint256 newFeeBps) external {\n        if (newFeeBps > MAX_WITHDRAWAL_FEE_BPS) {\n            revert InvalidWithdrawalFee(newFeeBps, MAX_WITHDRAWAL_FEE_BPS);\n        }\n        uint256 previous = _withdrawalFeeBps;\n        if (previous == newFeeBps) {\n            return;\n        }\n        _withdrawalFeeBps = newFeeBps;\n        emit WithdrawalFeeSet(previous, newFeeBps);\n    }\n\n    function setDepositCap(uint256 newCap) external {\n        uint256 managedAssets = _totalManagedAssets();\n        if (newCap != 0 && newCap < managedAssets) {\n            revert InvalidDepositCap(newCap, managedAssets);\n        }\n        uint256 previous = depositCap;\n        depositCap = newCap;\n        emit DepositCapUpdated(previous, newCap);\n    }\n\n    function recordShortfall(uint256 delta) external {\n        if (delta == 0) {\n            return;\n        }\n        uint256 managedAssets = _totalManagedAssets();\n        uint256 newShortfall = settlementShortfall + delta;\n        if (newShortfall > managedAssets) {\n            revert SettlementShortfallTooHigh(newShortfall, managedAssets);\n        }\n        uint256 previous = settlementShortfall;\n        settlementShortfall = newShortfall;\n        emit SettlementShortfallUpdated(previous, newShortfall);\n    }\n\n    function clearShortfall(uint256 amount) external {\n        if (amount == 0) {\n            return;\n        }\n        uint256 previous = settlementShortfall;\n        if (amount >= previous) {\n            settlementShortfall = 0;\n        } else {\n            settlementShortfall = previous - amount;\n        }\n        emit SettlementShortfallUpdated(previous, settlementShortfall);\n    }\n\n    function addAdapter(address strategyShare, address adapterAddress) external {\n        _addAdapter(strategyShare, adapterAddress);\n    }\n\n    function removeAdapter(address strategyShare) external {\n        if (!_removeAdapter(strategyShare)) revert AdapterNotFound(strategyShare);\n    }\n\n    function setDefaultDepositStrategyShare(address strategyShare) external {\n        if (_strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare] == address(0)) revert AdapterNotFound(strategyShare);\n        if (vaultExists[strategyShare]) {\n            VaultConfig memory config = _getVaultConfig(strategyShare);\n            if (!_isVaultStatusEligible(config.status, OperationType.DEPOSIT)) {\n                revert VaultNotActive(strategyShare);\n            }\n        }\n        _defaultDepositStrategyShare = strategyShare;\n        emit DefaultDepositStrategyShareSet(strategyShare);\n    }\n\n    function clearDefaultDepositStrategyShare() external {\n        _clearDefaultDepositStrategyShare();\n    }\n\n    function setDustTolerance(uint256 newDustTolerance) external {\n        dustTolerance = newDustTolerance;\n        emit DustToleranceSet(newDustTolerance);\n    }\n\n    function sweepSurplus(uint256 maxAmount) external {\n        uint256 balance = IERC20(_dStable).balanceOf(address(this));\n        if (balance == 0) revert ZeroInputDStableValue(_dStable, 0);\n\n        uint256 amountToSweep = (maxAmount == 0 || maxAmount > balance) ? balance : maxAmount;\n        address adapterAddress = _strategyShareToAdapter[_defaultDepositStrategyShare];\n        if (adapterAddress == address(0)) revert AdapterNotFound(_defaultDepositStrategyShare);\n\n        IDStableConversionAdapterV2 adapter = IDStableConversionAdapterV2(adapterAddress);\n        address strategyShare = adapter.strategyShare();\n\n        VaultConfig memory config = _getVaultConfig(strategyShare);\n        if (!_isVaultStatusEligible(config.status, OperationType.DEPOSIT)) {\n            revert VaultNotActive(strategyShare);\n        }\n\n        IERC20(_dStable).forceApprove(adapterAddress, amountToSweep);\n        (address mintedShare, ) = adapter.depositIntoStrategy(amountToSweep);\n        if (mintedShare != strategyShare) revert AdapterAssetMismatch(adapterAddress, strategyShare, mintedShare);\n        IERC20(_dStable).forceApprove(adapterAddress, 0);\n\n        emit SurplusSwept(amountToSweep, mintedShare);\n    }\n\n    function setVaultConfigs(VaultConfig[] calldata configs) external {\n        uint256 totalTargetBps = 0;\n        uint256 configCount = configs.length;\n        for (uint256 i; i < configCount; ) {\n            totalTargetBps += configs[i].targetBps;\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n        if (totalTargetBps != BasisPointConstants.ONE_HUNDRED_PERCENT_BPS) {\n            revert TotalAllocationInvalid(totalTargetBps);\n        }\n\n        _clearVaultConfigs();\n        for (uint256 i; i < configCount; ) {\n            _addVaultConfig(configs[i]);\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function addVaultConfig(VaultConfig calldata config) external {\n        _addVaultConfig(config);\n    }\n\n    function addVaultConfig(address vault, address adapter, uint256 targetBps, VaultStatus status) external {\n        _addVaultConfig(VaultConfig({ strategyVault: vault, adapter: adapter, targetBps: targetBps, status: status }));\n    }\n\n    function updateVaultConfig(VaultConfig calldata config) external {\n        _updateVaultConfig(config);\n    }\n\n    function updateVaultConfig(address vault, address adapter, uint256 targetBps, VaultStatus status) external {\n        _updateVaultConfig(\n            VaultConfig({ strategyVault: vault, adapter: adapter, targetBps: targetBps, status: status })\n        );\n    }\n\n    function setVaultStatus(address vault, VaultStatus status) external {\n        if (!vaultExists[vault]) revert VaultNotFound(vault);\n        uint256 index = vaultToIndex[vault];\n        VaultConfig storage config = vaultConfigs[index];\n        if (config.status == status) {\n            return;\n        }\n        config.status = status;\n        emit VaultConfigUpdated(config.strategyVault, config.adapter, config.targetBps, status);\n    }\n\n    function removeVault(address vault) external {\n        if (!vaultExists[vault]) revert VaultNotFound(vault);\n        _removeVault(vault);\n    }\n\n    function removeVaultConfig(address vault) external {\n        if (!vaultExists[vault]) revert VaultNotFound(vault);\n        _removeVault(vault);\n    }\n\n    function suspendVaultForRemoval(address vault) external {\n        _suspendVaultForRemoval(vault);\n    }\n\n    function emergencyPauseVault(address vault) external {\n        if (!vaultExists[vault]) revert VaultNotFound(vault);\n        uint256 index = vaultToIndex[vault];\n        vaultConfigs[index].status = VaultStatus.Suspended;\n        emit VaultConfigUpdated(\n            vault,\n            vaultConfigs[index].adapter,\n            vaultConfigs[index].targetBps,\n            VaultStatus.Suspended\n        );\n    }\n\n    function setMaxVaultCount(uint256 newMax) external {\n        if (newMax == 0 || newMax < vaultConfigs.length) revert InvalidMaxVaultCount(newMax);\n        uint256 previous = maxVaultCount;\n        if (newMax == previous) {\n            return;\n        }\n        maxVaultCount = newMax;\n        emit MaxVaultCountUpdated(previous, newMax);\n    }\n\n    // --- Internal helpers (copied from router) ---\n\n    function _addAdapter(address strategyShare, address adapterAddress) internal {\n        if (adapterAddress == address(0) || strategyShare == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        address adapterStrategyShare = IDStableConversionAdapterV2(adapterAddress).strategyShare();\n        if (adapterStrategyShare != strategyShare)\n            revert AdapterAssetMismatch(adapterAddress, strategyShare, adapterStrategyShare);\n        if (\n            _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare] != address(0) &&\n            _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare] != adapterAddress\n        ) {\n            revert VaultAssetManagedByDifferentAdapter(strategyShare, _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare]);\n        }\n        _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare] = adapterAddress;\n\n        if (vaultExists[strategyShare]) {\n            vaultConfigs[vaultToIndex[strategyShare]].adapter = adapterAddress;\n        }\n\n        try _collateralVault.addSupportedStrategyShare(strategyShare) {} catch {}\n\n        emit AdapterSet(strategyShare, adapterAddress);\n    }\n\n    function _removeAdapter(address strategyShare) internal returns (bool removed) {\n        address adapterAddress = _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare];\n        if (adapterAddress == address(0)) {\n            return false;\n        }\n\n        if (vaultExists[strategyShare]) {\n            VaultConfig storage config = vaultConfigs[vaultToIndex[strategyShare]];\n            if (config.status != VaultStatus.Suspended) {\n                revert VaultMustBeSuspended(strategyShare);\n            }\n            if (config.targetBps != 0) {\n                revert VaultTargetNotZero(strategyShare, config.targetBps);\n            }\n        }\n\n        _collateralVault.removeSupportedStrategyShare(strategyShare);\n\n        if (_defaultDepositStrategyShare == strategyShare) {\n            _clearDefaultDepositStrategyShare();\n        }\n\n        delete _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare];\n\n        if (vaultExists[strategyShare]) {\n            vaultConfigs[vaultToIndex[strategyShare]].adapter = address(0);\n        }\n\n        emit AdapterRemoved(strategyShare, adapterAddress);\n        return true;\n    }\n\n    function _clearDefaultDepositStrategyShare() internal {\n        if (_defaultDepositStrategyShare == address(0)) {\n            return;\n        }\n        _defaultDepositStrategyShare = address(0);\n        emit DefaultDepositStrategyShareSet(address(0));\n    }\n\n    function _suspendVaultForRemoval(address vault) internal {\n        if (!vaultExists[vault]) revert VaultNotFound(vault);\n        uint256 index = vaultToIndex[vault];\n        VaultConfig storage config = vaultConfigs[index];\n\n        bool mutated;\n        if (config.status != VaultStatus.Suspended) {\n            config.status = VaultStatus.Suspended;\n            mutated = true;\n        }\n\n        if (config.targetBps != 0) {\n            config.targetBps = 0;\n            mutated = true;\n        }\n\n        if (_defaultDepositStrategyShare == vault) {\n            _clearDefaultDepositStrategyShare();\n        }\n\n        if (mutated) {\n            emit VaultConfigUpdated(vault, config.adapter, config.targetBps, VaultStatus.Suspended);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _addVaultConfig(VaultConfig memory config) internal {\n        if (config.strategyVault == address(0) || config.adapter == address(0)) revert ZeroAddress();\n        if (vaultExists[config.strategyVault]) revert VaultAlreadyExists(config.strategyVault);\n        if (vaultConfigs.length >= maxVaultCount) revert InvalidVaultConfig();\n\n        uint256 index = vaultConfigs.length;\n        vaultConfigs.push(config);\n        vaultToIndex[config.strategyVault] = index;\n        vaultExists[config.strategyVault] = true;\n\n        _syncAdapter(config.strategyVault, config.adapter);\n\n        emit VaultConfigAdded(config.strategyVault, config.adapter, config.targetBps, config.status);\n    }\n\n    function _updateVaultConfig(VaultConfig memory config) internal {\n        if (!vaultExists[config.strategyVault]) revert VaultNotFound(config.strategyVault);\n\n        uint256 index = vaultToIndex[config.strategyVault];\n        vaultConfigs[index] = config;\n\n        _syncAdapter(config.strategyVault, config.adapter);\n\n        emit VaultConfigUpdated(config.strategyVault, config.adapter, config.targetBps, config.status);\n    }\n\n    function _removeVault(address vault) internal {\n        uint256 indexToRemove = vaultToIndex[vault];\n        uint256 lastIndex = vaultConfigs.length - 1;\n\n        _suspendVaultForRemoval(vault);\n\n        if (_strategyShareToAdapter[vault] != address(0)) {\n            _removeAdapter(vault);\n        }\n\n        if (indexToRemove != lastIndex) {\n            VaultConfig memory lastConfig = vaultConfigs[lastIndex];\n            vaultConfigs[indexToRemove] = lastConfig;\n            vaultToIndex[lastConfig.strategyVault] = indexToRemove;\n        }\n\n        vaultConfigs.pop();\n        delete vaultToIndex[vault];\n        delete vaultExists[vault];\n\n        emit VaultConfigRemoved(vault);\n    }\n\n    function _clearVaultConfigs() internal {\n        uint256 configCount = vaultConfigs.length;\n        for (uint256 i; i < configCount; ) {\n            address vault = vaultConfigs[i].strategyVault;\n            _suspendVaultForRemoval(vault);\n            _removeAdapter(vault);\n            delete vaultToIndex[vault];\n            delete vaultExists[vault];\n            unchecked {\n                ++i;\n            }\n        }\n        delete vaultConfigs;\n    }\n\n    function _syncAdapter(address strategyShare, address adapterAddress) internal {\n        address currentAdapter = _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare];\n        if (adapterAddress == address(0)) {\n            if (currentAdapter != address(0)) {\n                _removeAdapter(strategyShare);\n            }\n            return;\n        }\n\n        if (currentAdapter != address(0)) {\n            address adapterStrategyShare = IDStableConversionAdapterV2(adapterAddress).strategyShare();\n            if (adapterStrategyShare != strategyShare) {\n                revert AdapterAssetMismatch(adapterAddress, strategyShare, adapterStrategyShare);\n            }\n\n            _strategyShareToAdapter[strategyShare] = adapterAddress;\n            if (vaultExists[strategyShare]) {\n                vaultConfigs[vaultToIndex[strategyShare]].adapter = adapterAddress;\n            }\n            try _collateralVault.addSupportedStrategyShare(strategyShare) {} catch {}\n            emit AdapterSet(strategyShare, adapterAddress);\n            return;\n        }\n\n        _addAdapter(strategyShare, adapterAddress);\n    }\n\n    function _getVaultConfig(address vault) internal view returns (VaultConfig memory config) {\n        if (!vaultExists[vault]) revert VaultNotFound(vault);\n        return vaultConfigs[vaultToIndex[vault]];\n    }\n\n    function _isVaultStatusEligible(VaultStatus status, OperationType operationType) internal pure returns (bool) {\n        if (operationType == OperationType.DEPOSIT) {\n            return status == VaultStatus.Active;\n        }\n\n        return status == VaultStatus.Active || status == VaultStatus.Impaired;\n    }\n\n    function _totalManagedAssets() internal view returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 vaultValue = _collateralVault.totalValueInDStable();\n        uint256 idle = IERC20(_dStable).balanceOf(address(this));\n        return vaultValue + idle;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x464918d76173dd66264328e326da9e3137a69270c0ee03c43fe87db33ea08ea7","license":"MIT"},"contracts/vaults/dstake/DStakeRouterV2Storage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport { AccessControl } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol\";\nimport { Pausable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Pausable.sol\";\nimport { ReentrancyGuard } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol\";\n\nimport { BasisPointConstants } from \"../../common/BasisPointConstants.sol\";\nimport { IDStakeCollateralVaultV2 } from \"./interfaces/IDStakeCollateralVaultV2.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title DStakeRouterV2Storage\n * @notice Shared storage layout for {@link DStakeRouterV2} and its delegatecall modules.\n * @dev Inherit this contract to guarantee storage slot alignment across the router and modules.\n */\nabstract contract DStakeRouterV2Storage is AccessControl, ReentrancyGuard, Pausable {\n    // --- Errors ---\n    error ZeroAddress();\n\n    // --- Immutable addresses ---\n    address internal immutable _dStakeToken;\n    IDStakeCollateralVaultV2 internal immutable _collateralVault;\n    address internal immutable _dStable;\n\n    // --- Mutable configuration ---\n    uint256 public dustTolerance;\n    uint256 public maxVaultCount;\n    uint256 public depositCap;\n    uint256 public settlementShortfall;\n    uint256 public reinvestIncentiveBps;\n    uint256 internal _withdrawalFeeBps;\n\n    // --- Adapter routing ---\n    mapping(address => address) internal _strategyShareToAdapter;\n    address internal _defaultDepositStrategyShare;\n\n    // --- Vault configuration ---\n    enum OperationType {\n        DEPOSIT,\n        WITHDRAWAL\n    }\n\n    enum VaultStatus {\n        Active,\n        Suspended,\n        Impaired\n    }\n\n    struct VaultConfig {\n        address strategyVault;\n        address adapter;\n        uint256 targetBps;\n        VaultStatus status;\n    }\n\n    VaultConfig[] public vaultConfigs;\n    mapping(address => uint256) public vaultToIndex;\n    mapping(address => bool) public vaultExists;\n\n    // --- Module wiring ---\n    address public governanceModule;\n    address public rebalanceModule;\n\n    // --- Constants ---\n    uint256 public constant MAX_REINVEST_INCENTIVE_BPS = BasisPointConstants.ONE_PERCENT_BPS * 20;\n    uint256 public constant MAX_WITHDRAWAL_FEE_BPS = BasisPointConstants.ONE_PERCENT_BPS;\n    bytes32 internal constant STORAGE_FINGERPRINT = keccak256(\"dtrinity.dstake.router.v2.storage:1\");\n\n    constructor(address dStakeToken_, address collateralVault_) {\n        if (dStakeToken_ == address(0) || collateralVault_ == address(0)) {\n            revert ZeroAddress();\n        }\n\n        _dStakeToken = dStakeToken_;\n        _collateralVault = IDStakeCollateralVaultV2(collateralVault_);\n        address dStableAddress = _collateralVault.dStable();\n        if (dStableAddress == address(0)) {\n            revert ZeroAddress();\n        }\n        _dStable = dStableAddress;\n\n        // Defaults mirror the original router constructor.\n        dustTolerance = 1;\n        maxVaultCount = 10;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x72d769967b4fc8a798a0a0b89572ea8a8a3438a01353aaf21d988b806653133f","license":"MIT"},"contracts/vaults/dstake/interfaces/IDStableConversionAdapterV2.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\n/**\n * @title IDStableConversionAdapterV2 Interface\n * @notice Interface for contracts that handle the conversion between the core stable asset (dUSD/dETH)\n *         and a specific yield-bearing or convertible ERC20 token (`strategy share`), as well as\n *         valuing that `strategy share` in terms of the stable asset.\n * @dev Implementations interact with specific protocols (lending pools, DEX LPs, wrappers, etc.).\n * @dev SECURITY: adapters must mint strategy shares straight to the collateral vault, burn (or transfer out) those\n *      shares before calling upstream withdraws, and rely on preview/rate helpers so wrapper supply cannot diverge from\n *      the underlying balance. See `WrappedDLendInvariant.test.ts` for the regression harness new adapters should copy.\n */\ninterface IDStableConversionAdapterV2 {\n    /**\n     * @notice Converts a specified amount of the stable asset into the specific `strategyShare`\n     *         managed by this adapter.\n     * @dev The adapter MUST pull `stableAmount` of the stable asset from the caller (expected to be the Router).\n     * @dev The resulting `strategyShare` MUST be sent/deposited/minted directly to the `collateralVault` address provided during adapter setup or retrieved.\n     * @param stableAmount The amount of stable asset to convert.\n     * @return strategyShare The address of the specific `strategy share` token managed by this adapter.\n     * @return strategyShareAmount The amount of `strategyShare` generated from the conversion.\n     */\n    function depositIntoStrategy(\n        uint256 stableAmount\n    ) external returns (address strategyShare, uint256 strategyShareAmount);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Converts a specific amount of `strategyShare` back into the stable asset.\n     * @dev The adapter MUST pull the required amount of `strategyShare` from the caller (expected to be the Router).\n     * @dev The resulting stable asset MUST be sent to the caller.\n     * @param strategyShareAmount The amount of `strategyShare` to convert.\n     * @return stableAmount The amount of stable asset sent to the caller.\n     */\n    function withdrawFromStrategy(uint256 strategyShareAmount) external returns (uint256 stableAmount);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Preview the result of converting a given stable amount to strategyShare (without state change).\n     * @param stableAmount The amount of stable asset to preview conversion for.\n     * @return strategyShare The address of the specific `strategy share` token managed by this adapter.\n     * @return strategyShareAmount The amount of `strategyShare` that would be received.\n     */\n    function previewDepositIntoStrategy(\n        uint256 stableAmount\n    ) external view returns (address strategyShare, uint256 strategyShareAmount);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Preview the result of converting a given strategyShare amount to stable asset (without state change).\n     * @param strategyShareAmount The amount of `strategyShare` to preview conversion for.\n     * @return stableAmount The amount of stable asset that would be received.\n     */\n    function previewWithdrawFromStrategy(uint256 strategyShareAmount) external view returns (uint256 stableAmount);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Calculates the value of a given amount of the specific `strategyShare` managed by this adapter\n     *         in terms of the stable asset.\n     * @param strategyShare The address of the strategy share token (should match strategyShare()). Included for explicitness.\n     * @param strategyShareAmount The amount of the `strategyShare` to value.\n     * @return stableValue The equivalent value in the stable asset.\n     */\n    function strategyShareValueInDStable(\n        address strategyShare,\n        uint256 strategyShareAmount\n    ) external view returns (uint256 stableValue);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the address of the specific `strategy share` token managed by this adapter.\n     * @return The address of the `strategy share`.\n     */\n    function strategyShare() external view returns (address);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the underlying vault asset associated with this adapter (legacy compatibility helper).\n     */\n    function vaultAsset() external view returns (address);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xd98442e19119300779dc8f093c639ea0dab3d3dfb67580bfb84efb2a21ff888d","license":"MIT"},"contracts/vaults/dstake/interfaces/IDStakeCollateralVaultV2.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\n/**\n * @title IDStakeCollateralVaultV2 Interface\n * @notice Defines the external functions of the DStakeCollateralVaultV2 required by other\n *         contracts in the dSTAKE system, primarily the DStakeTokenV2.\n */\ninterface IDStakeCollateralVaultV2 {\n    /**\n     * @notice Calculates the total value of all managed `strategy shares` held by the vault,\n     *         denominated in the underlying dStable asset.\n     * @dev This is typically called by the DStakeTokenV2's `totalAssets()` function.\n     * @return dStableValue The total value of managed assets in terms of the dStable asset.\n     */\n    function totalValueInDStable() external view returns (uint256 dStableValue);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the address of the underlying dStable asset the vault operates with.\n     * @return The address of the dStable asset.\n     */\n    function dStable() external view returns (address);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice The DStakeTokenV2 contract address this vault serves.\n     */\n    function dStakeToken() external view returns (address);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice The DStakeRouter contract address allowed to interact.\n     */\n    function router() external view returns (address);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the strategy share at `index` from the internal supported list.\n     */\n    function supportedStrategyShares(uint256 index) external view returns (address);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns the entire list of supported strategy shares. Convenient for UIs & off-chain analytics.\n     */\n    function getSupportedStrategyShares() external view returns (address[] memory);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Transfers `amount` of `strategyShare` from this vault to the `recipient`.\n     * @dev Only callable by the registered router.\n     * @param strategyShare The address of the strategy share to send.\n     * @param amount The amount to send.\n     * @param recipient The address to receive the shares.\n     */\n    function transferStrategyShares(address strategyShare, uint256 amount, address recipient) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the address of the DStakeRouter contract.\n     * @dev Only callable by an address with the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.\n     * @param _newRouter The address of the new router contract.\n     */\n    function setRouter(address _newRouter) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Adds a strategy share to the supported list. Callable only by the router.\n     */\n    function addSupportedStrategyShare(address strategyShare) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Removes a strategy share from the supported list. Callable only by the router.\n     */\n    function removeSupportedStrategyShare(address strategyShare) external;\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when the router address is set.\n     * @param router The address of the new router.\n     */\n    event RouterSet(address indexed router);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when a new strategy share is added to the supported list.\n     */\n    event StrategyShareSupported(address indexed strategyShare);\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Emitted when a strategy share is removed from the supported list.\n     */\n    event StrategyShareRemoved(address indexed strategyShare);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x55c35fc025c34bbbc4e739f38d5abb72702f4d1ac1be91ae5b29d0270c281d1b","license":"MIT"},"contracts/vaults/dstake/interfaces/IDStakeRouterV2Module.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\n/**\n * @title IDStakeRouterV2Module\n * @notice Metadata surface every DStake router delegatecall module must expose so the router can validate wiring.\n */\ninterface IDStakeRouterV2Module {\n    /**\n     * @notice Returns module wiring metadata used to validate compatibility during router configuration.\n     * @return storageFingerprint Unique identifier for the expected storage layout version.\n     * @return dStakeTokenAddress Immutable dSTAKE token address baked into the module.\n     * @return collateralVaultAddress Immutable collateral vault address baked into the module.\n     */\n    function moduleMetadata()\n        external\n        view\n        returns (bytes32 storageFingerprint, address dStakeTokenAddress, address collateralVaultAddress);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xd35b46bff5fa522e1a913acec5b34c52eac3f340b7730ee1d9c8d6423ba5dd8d","license":"MIT"},"contracts/vaults/dstake/libraries/AllocationCalculator.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport { BasisPointConstants } from \"../../../common/BasisPointConstants.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title AllocationCalculator\n * @notice Library for calculating allocations, deficits, and amount distributions\n * @dev Provides stateless functions for allocation calculations used in the DStake Morpho Router V2\n */\nlibrary AllocationCalculator {\n    // Unused error types removed in refactor\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Calculates current allocations in basis points from vault balances\n     * @dev Allocation for vault i = (balance[i] * BasisPointConstants.ONE_HUNDRED_PERCENT_BPS) / totalBalance\n     * @param vaultBalances Array of vault balances\n     * @return allocations Array of current allocations in basis points\n     * @return totalBalance Sum of all vault balances\n     */\n    function calculateCurrentAllocations(\n        uint256[] memory vaultBalances\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256[] memory allocations, uint256 totalBalance) {\n        if (vaultBalances.length == 0) {\n            return (new uint256[](0), 0);\n        }\n\n        // Calculate total balance\n        totalBalance = 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < vaultBalances.length; i++) {\n            totalBalance += vaultBalances[i];\n        }\n\n        allocations = new uint256[](vaultBalances.length);\n\n        // Handle edge case where all balances are zero\n        if (totalBalance == 0) {\n            // All allocations remain 0\n            return (allocations, totalBalance);\n        }\n\n        // Calculate allocations in basis points\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < vaultBalances.length; i++) {\n            allocations[i] = (vaultBalances[i] * BasisPointConstants.ONE_HUNDRED_PERCENT_BPS) / totalBalance;\n        }\n\n        return (allocations, totalBalance);\n    }\n\n    // Unused AllocationCalculator helpers removed in refactor. Library intentionally only exposes\n    // calculateCurrentAllocations for production usage.\n}\n","keccak256":"0x559f2e391c3dc3169e62d401e361f302a966ac3b72dee9d273b2a1bb3e9feffe","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: This contract is designed to be delegate-called from the router. Storage layout **must** match the router's      layout for all shared state variables, including inherited OpenZeppelin base contracts. Access control checks      are enforced at the router level before delegating to this module.

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

EnforcedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is paused.

ExpectedPause().details: The operation failed because the contract is not paused.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns.collateralVaultAddress: Immutable collateral vault address baked into the module.
returns.dStakeTokenAddress: Immutable dSTAKE token address baked into the module.
returns.storageFingerprint: Unique identifier for the expected storage layout version.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.
